metadata.title: Thursday, 19th June, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether the conference facilities at the Government Complex in Lusaka are fully utilised;
(b)    how many events took place at the Complex from January, 2012 to December, 2013; and
(c)    how much money was raised from the events.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to abolish the Farmer Input Support Programme and, if so, when the plans will be effected; and
(b)    if the Programme will be retained, whether the Government has any plans to increase the number of bags of fertilizer allocated to farmers.
(a)    how many people have been employed by the Public Service Commission to be stationed in Chipili District;
(b)    where the recruitment was conducted; and
(c)    how many people have been employed from Chipili District.
(a)    why construction of staff houses at Mabua and Mutala Health Posts in Sikongo Parliamentary Constituency has stalled; and
(b)    when the project will be completed.
(a)    how much money, in terms of internal and external loans, the Government contracted from January 2012 to December, 2013;
(b)    what the effect of the loans on the economy is; and
(c)    how much interest had accrued on the loans as of January, 2014.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    who the contractor for the North-West Rail Project is; and
(b)    what support the Government is providing to ensure the project is successful.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when the following grants will be disbursed to Luwingu District Council:
(i)    the general purposes grant; (ii)    the restructuring grant for retirees; (iii)    the service provision grant; and (iv)    the grant in lieu of rates; and
(b)    how often the grants are disbursed to the Council.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    what Government policy on Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) is;
(b)    why the Government has allowed the importation of GMO food products such as corn flakes, polony and tinned beans; and
(c)    what other GMO foods and stock feed have been allowed on the Zambian market.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when bridges will be constructed across Chisanga and Mujila Rivers on the road from Chief Kakoma’s area to the newly constructed Kambimba Border Post in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency.

parts: (a)    when funds for the construction of Ndeke Village Hospital in Kitwe will be released;
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is;
(c)    who the contractor for the project is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for the project is.
